snippet: The Mets rode Dillon Gee’s strong start to a 4-2 lead, but in a scenario that has played out all too often this season, their relief corps proved incapable of holding the lead.
abstract: Arizona Diamondbacks defeat New York Mets, 5-4. Photo (M)5
lead_paragraph: An unforgiving script was replayed on Friday night for the Mets. A strong starting pitching performance, backed by solid run support, gave way to a relief corps incapable of holding the lead in a 5-4 loss to the Diamondbacks at Citi Field. It was the Mets' fourth straight defeat. ''It comes back to base on balls,'' Mets Manager Terry Collins said. ''Right now we're deep in counts, falling behind, and you can't do that.''

headline.main: Solid Start, Some Timely Hits, Then the Bullpen Was Called
